title: Jamelia breaks silence about being cut from Loose Women after those plus size comments
text:
Jamelia breaks silence about being cut from Loose Women after those plus size comments The TV presenter has also left her management after 15 years Share Jamelia has been axed from Loose Women (Photo: ITV) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
TV presenter Jamelia has spoken for the first time about being ‘axed’ from Loose Women . 
It was reported last October that the Brummie singer and personality had been dropped from the panel, with the suggestion it was because of the controversial comments she’d made about plus-sized women. 
In an exclusive interview with the Birmingham Mail - the former pop princess revealed she had not been asked back on the show since October. 
Fans will remember the star was allegedly dropped from the panel after infuriating show bosses with controversial comments about plus-size clothing. Ruth Langsford, Coleen Nolan, Jane Moore and Jamelia back when she was on the panel (Photo: ITV) The star was allegedly dropped from the panel after infuriating show bosses with controversial comments about plus-size clothing (Photo: ITV) 
During an episode which was aired back in April, she said: "I think everyone should have access to lovely clothes, but I do not think it’s right to facilitate people living an unhealthy lifestyle. 
"I don’t believe stores should stock clothes below or above a certain weight. They should be made to feel uncomfortable when they go in and can’t find a size." 
Jamelia has been silent on the subject, but now she reveals: “I haven’t been formally sacked by Loose Women, as other people have been in the past, so I technically still have a job with them. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Jamelia wasn't impressing producers (Photo: ITV) Jamelia and her daughters Teja and Tiani at the Royal Film Performance of Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom, at the Odeon Leicester Square, London (Photo: PA) She was supported by the panel (Photo: ITV) 
“But I haven’t been on the show since those reports, so people will make of it what they will. 
“The show is going in a different direction at the moment and I don’t seem to be a part of that narrative. 
“I am realistic, I doubt I’ll be going back. 
“But it’s OK, as I’m very excited about launching my own YouTube channel.” The star is still part of the ITV family despite her departure from Loose Women (Photo: ITV) 
Jamelia is no longer listed among the 14 regular panellists, like Nadia Sawalha, Coleen Nolan and Linda Robson, on the Loose Women website. 
Of her own TV channel, JameliaDotcom which she introduces in the above video, she says: “I absolutely love it, I’m really excited about it. 
“In the mainstream media there are not places for everyone, so I wanted to create a sort of club for people – for moms, especially those of teenagers, and for those interested in black grooming. 
“I want to share advice, tips and tricks. It’s a lifestyle channel that includes everything from style and health and beauty to cooking and parenting. 
“My two daughters are heavily involved in the production too. The glamorous star is concentrating on new projects (Photo: Getty) 
“I recently left my management so I’m going through a bit of a transition. I’m taking control of what I’m doing, though it is a big challenge! It’s hard work so I think I will have to get a new manager. 
“There wasn’t a big row, it’s just I have been with my management for 15 years. They’ve been fantastic but sometimes when you’re in a long relationship it gets a bit boring and monotonous. 
“It was time to move on.” 
Jamelia was speaking at the judging of the Mail’s Pride of Birmingham Awards , in partnership with TSB, which celebrate the region’s remarkable people. 
An ITV spokesperson told Mirror Online: "Jamelia remains part of the ITV Daytime family and is currently working on This Morning." Like us on Facebook
